The room was very clean, bed very comfy and free wired internet access.
My only complaint is street noise.
We were on the street side of the hotel, and the street was pretty noisy with people all night long.
Not really the hotels fault, just the location.
This hotel ain't cheap, but it is in the middle of a very touristy area.
The only way I was able to stay here was by using some Marriott gift certificates we had.

author: kiasmum
segments: Loved it! An absolute gem of a hotel!
Extremely friendly and very helpful staff.
Clean,comfortable room.
Comfortable bed with fresh sheets everyday.
Secure safe in the room for your valuables.
Plenty of choice for breakfast.
Hotel is located within 500m of the Duomo and within easy walking distance of all the major sights.
If you can't be without the internet there is even free access in the bar.
Will we stay there again-Yes!!!

author: NVRam123
segments: Great location We stayed at the Le
Meridien right after they took over from the Park Hyatt so things were still a bit chaotic-everything still said Hyatt.
Despite that the service was great, the room was luxurious and we had a great time.
The rooms are slightly masculine in feel.
The room service was particularly good.
The location is great right near the Embarcadero with the ferry building and all the shops.
Very easy to walk to restaurants, even to walk to North Beach.
This hotel is very quiet and convenient.
We will definitely stay there again.

author: trainer5740
segments: Great location, perfectly nice hotel
We stayed at the Hotel Casci on the first 2 nights of our 2 week trip.
It was a perfect location, allowing us to get out quickly to see the sights, and make easy visits back for a rest or to freshen up.
The staff are absolutely lovely.
We had a bit of a crisis and were frantically awaiting a package to be delivered from home; they were exceptionally accommodating and helpful, even when I'm sure we were driving them nuts.
The breakfasts were some of the best we had throughout our trip.
The room was a reasonable size, and the bathroom was quite large compared to our other stays.
The entire hotel was spotless.
Our only complaint - and this is a really odd one - is that our room smelled of what we could only describe as cabbage.
Our room was towards the back of the hotel, and the smell became evident the further back you walked.
We never determined if it was the water and dampness in the room if we didn't leave our windows open (our guess), our someone in the courtyard with a deep love of boiled cabbage.
Like I said, very odd.
It certainly wouldn't keep us from staying there again.
It's also become kind of a fun joke that we still mention.
Overall, a great hotel in a city where I'm sure it's easy to pick a bad one.
Again, I can't say enough about the staff - just fabulous people.

author: sunseeker64  <Content>Wow... you won't be dissapointed at the Punta Cana
segments: Princess !!!
That is a promise....
I was obsessive about reading the reviews and checking out the forums for the PCP for weeks before my trip and all I can say is this resort is fantastic.
If you go with the attitude that you are on vacation and leave your expectations at home, you will have the time of your life.
That being said, there are some areas that will exceed your expectations.
Rooms: Very nice, clean, clean, clean.
a/c worked exceedingly well and the maids were fantastic.
Don't forget to tip...
They work from sun up until very, very late at night and make next to nothing.
Pool : Beautiful, well kept, lots of shade and the swim up bar was great.
No kids, no loud music and if I had to offer only one morsel, it was that there was no pool side drink service.
You had to either swim up or walk up to get served.
Staff: These people are the hardest workers I have ever seen.
They work and work and work to make this resort clean and comfortable.
They are quick with a hello and the hugs are a plenty.
Tip, tip, tip and you will not be sorry.
A buck goes a very long way.
Beach: Not much to say here but lovely.
One of the most beautiful I have ever seen...
Food : Well ........This is the only negative experience that I can speak of.
Although there are many choices, don't go with an expectation that you will be having a fine dining experience.
The fodd was tolerable and I always found somehting to eat, but honestly it just isn't very good.
From everything that I have heard and read this is not just at the PCP, but at most of the resorts too.
The cuts of meat are different and they try very hard to have something for everyone.
To me (and I am a foodie from SF) this is not a deal breaker.
Drinks: Unless you like really sweet drinks, you might want to consider bringing your own mixers..
I know that sounds crazy but even the mixer were a little odd.
The soda was odd, the tonic was odd and the OJ tasted like tang.
There really is no good wine choice and if you are a wine drinker, bring your own.
The beer is okay when cold (don't forget the bubba keg) and there is always a very happy and gracious bartender to get you whatever you want.
I love my morning mimosa(s) !!!!
Bottom line - this is a terrific place.
I would not hesitate to return or to recommend the PCP to anyone.
Go with a good attitude, plenty of ones and fives (100.
00 of both), a couple of good books, ton's of sunscreen, bug spray and a bubba keg and a good time is assured !!!

author: the_admiral_MB
segments: Terrible from start to finish
This was my worst hotel stay ever.
Hotwire should be embarrassed go carry this hotel.
When I arrive the valet man start yelling at us.
The we went inside and the manager didn't really care.
He was to busy flirting with the female guests.
We final got checked in and they put us in a room between the ice machine and the elevator so it was noisy all the time.
The every morning at 8:00 AM housekeeping would knock.
There were no Do Not Disturb signs.
Then after telling htem to come back later.
They would be back in 15 minutes.
We final wrote a note on the door but they did not speak english to read it.
Then one night we returned about 1:30 AM to crash and our neighbor left on his music really loud.
We called downstairs and they replied Sorry.
We finally got someone to come turn it off about 2:30 AM.
Then on checkout, there was yet another mess.
Needless to say, I will not return.
I explained how bad everything was when I left, they replied you will have to talk to hotwire.

author: WendySouthAfrica
segments: Wonderful hotel but bring your ear plugs
We felt very welcome and comfortable right from the beginning.
All reception staff were great and more than ready to answer any questions we might have had.
Room was comfortable, quite spacious, well appointed and very clean.
Breakfast, although continental was also quite good, particularly coffee which was excellent.
Breakfast available until 10.30 which was also nice.
Good location, near to trams and nice restaurant area.
Lovely park nearby too.
Shuttle from airport worked well.
However on the minus side lighting in room at night was dim and bedside lights were a strain to read by, which we like to do.
The bedroom walls are also paper thin and so you are disturbed by other room sounds.
Anyone running a bath/shower or using a hair dryer could be doing so in your own room.
Also all doors seem to have to slam to close.
So unless you are a really early riser or a really heavy sleeper, the noise factor will be quite a problem.

author: paulos1
segments: Fantastic This was the first leg of our five week
Europe excursion and it was simply superb.
The loctaion was as good as it gets and overall couldn't be faulted.
All staff were so helpful, deluxe rooms incredibly spacious with the beds being the closest thing to heaven.
I read all the review and i thanks to them i decided to stay here.
Trust me you won't be disappointed.
I am travelling back to London next year and won't stay anywhere else.

author: Tuto
segments: Great location, views
We recently stayed at this Hilton on Kearny St. (3/23/07).
It has recently been remodeled and looks beautiful, very modern and super clean.
This hotel is actually closer to Chinatown than it is to the Financial District.
It is a great location - close to North Beach, Union Square and Chinatown.
We stayed on the seventeeth floor.
Our room (1717) had a great view of the bay, Coit tower and the St. Peter Paul Church Spires.
It was a little pricier but so worht it if you are into views.

author: luvindublin
segments: Run Away Expedia rated this as a 4 Star
Hotel, which is horribly misleading.
I wish I had read reviews on this site prior to booking.
The hotel is advertised as being newly refurbished with luxurious rooms.
The first room we were taken to had only a shower, and barely enough room to set down our bags.
It was not newly refurbished by any means.
The second room we were shown was again, extremely small, and very hot.
I asked why the air conditioning was not on, and was told they turn it off during this time of the year.
The small window on the slanted ceiling opened minimally and was of no help.
We asked again to be moved to one of their luxurious suites (as advertised on their website) and were told they had no such thing as a suite in that hotel.
The only good thing I would say about this hotel is that the manager had enough sense to call Expedia to assist with getting our reservations changed.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: We loved our stay
I was expecting the worst and received the best.
This Hotel is located just two blocks from the Pacific Science Center and the Space Needle.
If you are looking to do downtown Seattle as a tourist you cannot do much better, in my opinion, than the Best Western Executive Inn.
I utilized Expedia and got a double queen for 65.00 a night.
In my opinion it was a great deal.
I and my daughter cannot think of one negative experience.
Secure parking was a nice plus.
Front desk staff was exceptional.
Breakfast was great.
Rooms were clean and comfortable.
Bottom line.....Great value in Downtown Seattle and I would stay there again and again.

author: jma52
segments: keep your cancellation number
I made a reservation to stay here in August 2007 and just got charged for the night I canceled.
So I would recommend that if you reserve a room here and cancel SAVE YOUR CANCELATION NUMBER!

author: acemarble47
segments: not as friendly as these posts elude
Because of all the positive comments we had read here, we weren't too worried about our stay.
Unfortunately, we were not very pleased.
The place seemed a little run down and the staff was not friendly at all.
The woman at the front desk didn't even greet us with a hello to us when we came into the front office...something you would expect if everyone proclaims they are friendly.
In addition, when we met up with our friends and they helped us unload our luggage, the lady from the front desk ran out and confronted us about having extra people.
We explained that they were our friends FROM SF there to show us around...only helping us carry our luggage.
When we checked out the next day she yelled from the front office window at us, while we are on the street.... that she was charging us for extra people....and they did!
However, only 2 of us stayed at the hotel!!
So much for friendly staff!
We've stayed in San Francisco before and I would recommend the Commodore Hotel or another Experience Rewards hotel in the SF area.
Those were similarly priced, friendlier, and a better quality room for the money.
I would avoid this place and would not go hear again.

author: Stephansen
segments: Great Hotel My girlfriend and
I stayed for a week at ?
The Lenox?
in Boston.
The hotel is located right in the middle of Boston?
s Back Bay area.
The location is perfect and close to everything Boston has to offer.
We had booked a standard room, but upon arrival we were asked if we wanted an upgrade to a superior room, for a very small surcharge.
The room was just wonderful and was well furbished with a large bed and a working desk.
The bathroom was quite small but it was nice and clean.
However the best thing about the room was the wonderful view of the Boston skyline.
The hotel staff was very helpful and we felt very welcome at the hotel.
There is no doubt the next time we go to Boston we?
ll stay at ?
The Lenox?
again.

author: GiveMeMORE
segments: Stunning and refreshing
One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in.
First of all, the stunning design bowled us over - we didn't want to leave the room.
The staff was very friendly and did their best to please us.
The hotel is still new, so their bar wasn't open, but their sauna was great.
Room service was on the pricey side - two coffees were 11 Euro.
We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel.
Note that the hotel offers great packages on its website - the best way to go.
They offeryou a choice of pillows - a neck roll, a spelt pillow, a hot water bottle - they encourage you to ask for them and that really made the trip special.
Also the location is excellent - right next to the SBahn, 10 minutes from the Reichstag on foot.
I can't wait to go back, my husband and I considered the hotel a high point of the trip.

author: anniet66
segments: Mary Jane Rocks at the Magic Castle!
We enjoyed our stay last week at the Magic Castle.
We got a great rate that was advertised on Travelzoo.
com.
The rooms are okay.
They are huge but need a bit of freshening up.
Breakfast was sufficient for being free and the pool was nice.
Parking for $9 was the cheapest we saw on our trip.
The best part about this hotel is the front desk attendant Mary Jane.
She provided us insight on where to go and what to do, helped us book reservations at the hottest restaurants and used her connections to get us it.
It became a joke that every day we had to go to Mary Jane to figure out what we were going to do and where we were going to eat!
She is the best part about Magic Castle and deserves a raise!!!(
and no, I am NOT related to her!)

author: Numbersdiva
segments: Overall Good Value for the Money
We enjoyed our stay, but we always make the best of a situation.
I will just list the good and bad (good first);Breakfast was good, lots of choices.
Nice view of Diamond Head and the movie screen on the beach.
Updated (meaning decor, not renovated really)Nice decor, fun, floralSmall refrigerator in the roomOne Valet and One Front Desk clerk were super!
Nice seating options at the pool, nice lounging areas, relaxing.
(Bad next):Service (except the two mentioned) terrible- no sense of urgency, slow response times, etc.Room was TINY (we had to upgrade).
Two full size beds in a tiny closet of a room (1107) with four people, three over 5'8 tall.
It was too small, the bathroom is tiny, can hardly turn around in it!
Watch the bartender at Tiki's, they let some blond guy from Iowa charge his drinks to my tab without asking me about it.
Considering I had just arrived (with my three kids) it wasn't likely I was buying drinks for some stanger in a bar.
He eventually reversed the charges, but seemed surprised that I didn't know the guy.Slow, slow service at the front desk, don't be in a hurry.
We called for our luggage (take yours up yourself) and they said five to ten minutes.
We waited thirty and it still had not arrived, so after two calls down (and snotty clerks) we just left.
The luggage came sometime later while we were at dinner.
The pool was small and most always very crowded.
My ten year old wouldn't go in due to it being too full.
We are the type to always make the best of a situation, so we did.
We had an enjoyable stay, it wasn't terrible, but I wouldn't be inclined to stay at that hotel again.
However, I was told that many of the hotel rooms are very small, I don't know if this is true.
Thanks to Del (valet area) and Kieth (front desk) we were taken care of.
The rest of the staff were aloof and didn't really have any concept of customer service.
Final note, FOR THE MONEY ($159/nt) and the fact that it's right across the road from the main beach, it's a decent value for a nice location.
We found most beach front locations to be much more costly.
It is a cute place, they have done some fun things with the decor.
There is easy access to food downstairs, Starbucks on the corner, ABC Markets everywhere.
Also, if you need services find a good front desk clerk, they helped us find a rental car when we were told none were available at all locations we called.

author: cookie43
segments: A Bit of a Disappointment
My teenage daughter and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in early July.
Our room was dark due to subdued lighting and a small window, but to be fair I did ask for a quiet room.
It was fairly quiet.
If I had known what we would get, I would have asked for a room with a large window.
The room had a very swampy odour when the air conditioning was turned off.
We tried to leave our extra card in the outlet slot so the air conditioning would stay on, but it was taken out by the maid and eventually she took it for good.
I had some febreeze so it was bearable.
The decor was nice, different and a bit funky.
The in-room shower was not a problem at all.Our minibar did not work and when I asked at the desk they offered me ice.
I was happy to get it, but a working minibar would have been preferable.
The staff were very helpful and always polite.
The restaurant they recommended was good.
I think it was called Ginger.
The area was really nice, away from the crazy busy areas.
Overall it was an o.k. experience, but I would probably try somewhere else the next time.

author: robbo84
segments: great hotel Just back today from 3 days staying at the owl hotel.
,celebrating couple of b'days.
Had a great time.
Hotel was in a great location.
Close to the Leidsplien and other main streets.
Rooms were fine - (some nicer than others), but all were cleaned every day.
Staff were always pleasant and helpful.
Bar prices very good.
Little terrace was lovely for sitting and relaxing.
Breakfast was very good with a choice of cereal, various breads, ham, cheese, eggs, fruit salad, juice + a selection of teas and coffee.
This hotel will definetly be my choice of hotel when we plan our next visit to Amsterdam.

author: niclou
segments: Perfect locaion, wonderful staff!
My husband and I just stayed at the Grand Hyatt and loved it.
We were in Seattle for a meeting at the convention center and it was right across the street.
It was the perfect location for shopping,too.
Everything is right there and you are in walking distance of Pike Market Place.
The hotel has a Starbucks, Ruth Chris Steakhouse and The Cheesecake Factory.
Ruth Chris is also the hotel's main restauraunt and bar.
They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner there.
The breakfast selection was terrific and of course the dinner was fabulous.
We never had lunch there, but I'm sure it was good also.
They have a great happy hour with half price appetizers from 4-6 and again from 9-11.
The rooms were nice and the bathrooms were great.
There is a coffeemaker in the room, a nice hairdryer, iron and ironing board and a safe in the closet.
Everything you need right there.
The staff was so nice and helpful, they really added to our wonderful week in Seattle.
If we are ever back in Seattle, we will definatley stay at the Grand Hyatt!

author: healysa
segments: A charming place to stay The
Chancellor exudes charm and character.
The staff are exceptional and the location is as good as it gets - one min walk from Union Square.
We stayed at The Orchard Hotel when we first arrived, it was twice the price and is further away from Union Square.
Our room was compact but exceptionally clean and comfortable.
This hotel reminds me of an old New York hotel.
After three weeks travelling in CA and staying in all types of accommodation (5 star, BB's etc) The Chancellor is one of the nicest places we have stayed.
PS. the breakfast is good!

author: labi88
segments: Good Times -
Lots of fun Me and my girlfriend just returned from the bravelo beach resort in Punta Cana, and we were overall very satisfied.
The resort was right on the beach lots of palm Trees very tropical, we always had good service at the restaurants; the best and most friendly restaurant was the Mexican.
The service was very welcoming, the bars were really busy and the wait for drinks took a little longer, but we were not disappointed waiting a few extra minutes for our drinks.

The staff was very friendly, sometimes they looked overworked and tired, but if you are nice to them and treat them with respect they will give you a smile and serve you well.I read a lot of negative reviews about this resort, but to be very honest as I do a lot of traveling to the Caribbean countries this one was defiantly a decent resort with lots of great activities.
When you travel to the Caribbean you have to be prepared that not everything is going to be perfect, but you have to have a positive attitude and always make the best out of everything.

author: RobertJohn773
segments: Small, but sexy room
Yes, the room is small.
The queen sized bed on one wall with a small desk on one side and a small nightstand on the other.
However, the room is styled so nicely and sexy that it's not even noticed.
Excellent bedding and appointments really set this place apart from other rooms in this town.
It's San Francisco, how much time do you really expect to spend in the room!?!?!
The bathroom is really nice sized considering the size of the room; plenty large enough for two people to navigate in.
The Aveda products were also a nice surprise!
The sitting room off to the side of the room was the best part; plasma screen on the wall, armoire for hanging up clothes, a mini bar and a loveseat.
Even with all of that in the room it still didn't feel small to me.This room is perfect for two people coming in to town for a weekend getaway or one person traveling on business.
I will certainly stay here again when I pass through.

author: jlw1013
segments: Heavenly is right!
This was our first stay at a Westin, and it was definitely very close to heaven.
The rooms were very clean, and we had a beautiful view of the Hudson river from the 22nd floor.
The beds were extremely comfortable as is the trademark of the Heavenly beds.
The service was good overall, and breakfast we had was delivered on time and was very tasty.
I had to ask for bathrobes which were advertised as part of the room package, but they were delivered promptly.
The bathroom door was a pocket metal door with a glass insert panel that slammed shut every time it closed.
You could hear the doors shut in the adjacent rooms as well, but overall it was a great experience for Times Square during the Christmas season.
The price was jacked up for the Christmas holiday, but you only live once!

author: Dieterj
segments: Perfect hotel at a perfect location
My girlfriend and me stayed at the hotel Cadran over the wekend.
The room we had was perfect.
It was newly renovated, clean and had a modern design.
Also the location of the hotel is perfect.
It is only a short walk away from the Eiffel tower.
The metro station and lots of good restaurants are just around the corner.
Even though the room was very quiet.I highly recommend this hotel and I will definetly stay here again at my next Paris visit.

author: cactus_pete
segments: NYC in the summer
Stayed here for an overnight while we were in town for a show.
Hotel is good for a home base, but not real big (no business center, etc).
Good location between Times Square and Central Park, Blue line station on 50th and 8th, walk to theaters, plus hot and cold breakfast with 2 staff members in the dining area.
Rooms are standard, beds are new, staff in helpful.
They were selling broadway theater tix at the concierge desk.
Call ahead, but I think that offered a different show each day.
Good price ($200) for a clean, safe, mid-town room (2 double beds) that includes breakfast.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: "it wont dissapoint!"
Content>We stayed here for two nights on the recommendation of others on trip advisor.
We were very cautious because we were taking our two year old daughter and wanted to ensure that it was suitable.
Well, it didnt let us down.
We stayed in a 1 bedroom lake view suit.
It was clean, modern and spacious enough.
We were suprised by the 42 flat screen tv on the wall when we opened the door!.
Content>There was some road noise at night, not from the main road directly below, but from the free-way behind, but this didnt spoil our much needed sleep.
The pool was fine, clean and towels were available in the pool area.
Like others before, i agree that the lift took ages to arrive at times, which was mildly frustrating!.
The courtesy bus was excellent and always available.A great hotel!

author: desgirl
segments: Loved this hotel
I disagree with some of the reviews i have read on tripadvisor re this hotel.
we stayed one night at the loew's hotel miami beach where we have stayed many times and then moved to this hotel for 2 nights.
what a huge difference!
the mandarin blows loew's away...and we will be staying at the mandarin in the future.
From the time you walk in the door, this hotel makes you feel welcome.
the staff goes out of their way to make sure you are happy and comfortable.

there were always two doormen opening the lobby doors and my car door, offering bottled water for my drive; the front desk walked us to the elevators; the room attendants were dressed nicely and left special touches in the room and the room was very clean - my husband and i took a bath both nights (we never do that); the bath towels are luxurious; the room size and the bathroom size are larger than most; the bed is very comfortable; the hotel is very generous with room amenities; the food at cafe sambal was delicious (azul was closed for renovations).
Yes the pool is small but the last thing i want to do at a hotel is sit around a pool with a lot of people.
the beach was magnificent.

I suppose the thing that stood out most to me was the friendliness of the staff; if they weren't genuine, they certainly fooled me and my mate. i loved every aspect of this hotel and i will definitely be back, especially to go to the spa. the spa looks unbelievable and unfortunately, we were on business and did not have the time.

author: ivoryb
segments: Ticks all the boxes
Have recently returned from a four night stay in the lenox a great experience.
Firstly location is perfect close to Boston Common and handy for trains ( harvard trip a must) and short taxi rides to anywhere else you want to visit.
The rooms were well appointed and roomy enough bathrooms were fine.
There are two bars an Irish bar a little more casual and the city bar very busy and a little more highbrow.
The gym is small but does a job.Staff very pleasant over all and doorstaff were very helpful.
Overall if you stay at the lenox you will not be disappointed

author: Pekul
segments: Lovely Hotel Cannot speak highly enough of The London Bridge Hotel.
Our room was delightful, the service was brilliant and the breakfast was superb.
Stayed for three nights in July and wished it was longer!!!
Thanks to all staff.

author: TOTravel_Gurl
segments: Beautiful Stay Wonderful hotel, excellent location!
You are in walking distance (minutes) to Bourbon Street, Canal Street, and the French Market.
The rooms were beautiful, not large, but definitely enough room for two.
The hotel has completed $70 million in renovations, and it shows.
The bathroom was decorated with marble tile and granite countertop.
The shower was great- lots of pressure and no temperature fluctuations.
The hotel bar is unique with a revolving central carousel.
The Hunt Grill was wonderful- try the crab bisque and crab cakes.
They left an offer in our room for a free bottle of wine with 2 entrees in the restaurant, which was a nice touch.
We would definitely return to this hotel!

author: paaatkooo
segments: ugly inside, nice outside (nice location) aaaaahh!
very ugly room.
but it has a very nice location.

author: escholte
segments: Great Stay in Downtown Miami
We chose the Mandarin Oriental as we felt to old for South Beach and we were glad we made the right choice.
The hotel is lovely - all rooms have balconies and we chose the Executive Suite - lots of space and a lovely bathroom.
A cab to SoBe was $30 and if you're staying at the M.O. then this is a small price to pay.
The service was very good, prices for meals and drinks expensive as you would expect - no point in whinging about a $12 martini if your paying hundreds for the room.
For those of us visitors without cars, taxis were easy to get and there is a new complex called Mary Brickell Village which has some good restaurants and is a 10 minute walk away.
The in-room facilities have it all, although no flat screen TVs yet.
The amenities are Aromatherapy Associates of London - smell of lavender and rose - delightful, conditioner is great.
Load of fresh fluffy towels.
Pool is a bit small but adequate, the gym well equipped but not used much.
Azul was a fantastic meal - delicious contempory food and slick service but the only detractor was that it arrived on a cold plate.

The only other detractor was the bar - off to one side of reception and seemed like a last minute thought - slick service and a list of over 200 martini - we were sorry we didn't stay long enough to try them all.

author: Fredbear
segments: Wonderful Hotel We stayed at this hotel for two nights to celebrate my birthday, and couldn't have asked for better.
We had booked one of the red rooms, but on arrival were informed that one of the suites was available in an adjacent building down a short Calle.
We were offered it at a reduced rate of an additional 鈧?
0 a night instead of the usual 鈧?
0 with breakfast included.
Once we had seen the picture, we were hooked and when we saw it, we knew we had made the right choice.
It was lovely, and looked very recently done.
There was a king size fourposter bed,draped in white muslin.
Dressing table, and wardrobe all beautifully decorated.
The walls are covered in cream striped fabric, and there are very beautiful wall lights and table lamps.
The windows were dressed with acres more white muslin and luxuriously draped curtains.

The room was equipped with a security box in the wardrobe and a very efficient mini bar, not to mention the wall mounted flat screen TV.The bathroom was spotlessly clean, and equipped with a superb shower cubicle.
Everything from spare toothbrushes, razors , shower caps, shoe polishing sponges and a very handy sewing kit.
Huge, white fluffy bath sheets too.The airconditioning unit was very efficient.
The double glazing kept out all noise, and the shutters were excellent too.
It was hard to believe that you were only a couple of hundred yards away from the Grand Canal, you heard nothing, not even the church bells!
The entry hall was all marble, as were the two flights of stairs you had to climb to get to our suite.
Entry was via a buzzer system operated from the reception area, then a security card key to your suite.
We were never kept waiting to get in form more than a minute.
The hotel has tables and chairs right on the Grand Canal, and a shady area to the side under two large sun shades.
We sat there for a couple of hours every afternoon with a drink or two just watching Venice pass by.
Entertainment was provided by the Gondoliers based at the Gondola station right outside the notel, their banter is wonderful to watch.
Breakfast was very good, cheese and cold meats, boiled eggs yoghurts, cereals, juice and a wide array of pastries and fresh fruit.
We got down later one morning, nearer 10 than 7, and there was still plenty to choose from.
Fresh coffee is made for you from an impressive machine at reception.
A choice of teas was also available.
The breakfast room was very well presented, and you can also breakfast outside or in the bar area.
We did all three during our stay.
The reception staff and all the waiting/bar staff were extremely helpful and friendly.
Nothing was too much trouble.
Reception was full of flowers, and an enduring memory of the hotel will be the scent of lilies, gorgeous!
We will definately be returning, and recommending it to anyone we know is intending to visit Venice.
Almost forgot, it is even easier to find it when you arrive at Piazza Roma than the website says, and takes less than 10 minutes to walk even with a case.
They were also more than happy to store our luggage before and after check out, which was brilliantEverything is right there on the doorstep.
You cannot go wrong.
We were asked when we left if we could think of anyway the stay could have been better, we honestyly couldn't hink of anything at all.
On reflection, a chest of drawers might be a useful addition to Room 515, but in the scale of things, how minor is that?
Pretty much faultless, we loved it.

author: Lynn-in-Chapel-Hill
segments: Great value in Seattle
Myself and spouse stayed at the Warwick Seattle for four days in September.
This hotel does not disappoint as a reasonably priced stay in the downtown area.
It's an easy walk to all sightseeing attractions (five blocks from the waterfront) and there is a free bus in Seattle but we could never figure out how that worked (do some research before you go!!).
Our room (king bed) was spacious and nicely appointed, very comfortable and with plenty of pillows.
The coffee in the room of course was great (this being Seattle).
The bath is finished in marble with a deep tub and hand-held shower which was a nice touch.
Toiletries were below average but that's not a huge consideration for us.
Our only complaints concerned the front desk.
I had made two reservations: one for the first part of our trip and one for the third leg (after Olympic Penninsula) but decided to cancel the second reservation.
When we arrived at the hotel after a full day of travel the desk clerk kept us waiting for several minutes without so much as a hello.
We moved to the second desk clerk when she was free and were told that our reservation could not be found.
No attempt was made to look for it.
We had to walk up the stairs to the parking garage and get our confirmation from our luggage and only then did they find the reservation.
The following day my office tried to call and was told that we weren't staying there.
Parking is $21/day which is pretty steep but the only option because parking in Seattle is scarce.

The hotel doesn't have a shuttle so the only other option was a cab which is about $30.The hotel restaurant is adequate but for a really great breakfast walk a block to the Mayflower Park Hotel (pricey but fabulous).

author: laurette9
segments: Good position, nice staff and very clean rooms !

We have stayed 3 nights in september 2006 in the Catedral Hotel in Mexico and we really enjoyed it !All the requirements for a quick visit of Mexico city are there:- Mexico is a huge city with many places to see and this hotel is at 5 minutes from the Zocalo, 5 min from the centro historico and 2 very close metro stations are in the area.- The hotel in itself is very nice, the staff is multilingual speaking and the room was very clean and well agenced.
The bathroom is also very nice and quite big.
- The restaurant of the hotel serves very good breakfast for honest prices and the evenig you can also eat there correctly and have a quite light bill.
- other services are available : travel agency, security boxes in the reception, internet for 10 pesos per 15 minutes and the reception can keep your luggages if you are away for your last day...

author: Vickie_Bernie
segments: Great Place, Great Price, Great Staff, But...
Well so much good had been said about this hotel I knew we would be happy staying here.
It was easy to find, parking for free is a bonus and boy oh boy was Versa a wealth of information!
She was always smiling, and ready with any questions.
We booked the city tour thru her (she did all the calling) and she helped us reserve tickets for Alcatraz.
The location is perfect, right in the middle of the city, easy to walk anywhere, or hop on transit.
And we did, we saw so much!
The positives on the room are that is was a large room, king bed was nice, it was also very clean.
Negatives, sheets had small holes or even areas where it was torn.
Towels were small and very rough.
Very thin walls and floors, could hear your neighbours all around.
Furniture was old and shows the wear and tear.
Water in the shower went from cold to hot and back again.
All in all it was adequate for what we needed.
The price was certainly good.
But I don't think I would stay here again, I may need to pay more and get more.

author: serenityseekerFL
segments: Inexpensive Boutique-like Hotel
If you don't mind a 20 minute train ride to get into the city, this is the place to stay in Amsterdam.
I booked this hotel for less than $100 USD and it is one of the best values that I have ever received from a hotel.
The check-in is amazingly quick and can be done without talking to anyone, if you choose.
The computer guides you through the system; however, two guest service personnel stand by for your convenience.
The lobby is beautiful.
The room is small (the width of the room is the length of a kingsized bed), but it is so well laid out, you would hardly notice the size.
The pod toilet is private enough that you don't feel awkward about utilizing the facility with another person in the room.
The TV and the room remote control is awesome.
Now, the only negative about this room...the shower.
Since the pod shower only works when it is closed, it is not possible to get warm water flowing before you step into the pod.
This burst of cold water from the roof of the shower is quite the wake-up.
The check-out from the room is just as easy as the check-in.
The hotel is immediately adjacent to the airport and it is perfect for early morning departures!
Also, I will seriously consider this as my base hotel for visiting Amsterdam in the future, despite the fact that it is a brief train ride from the center of town.
Note, the room can only accommodate two people who are close!
Meaning, don't expect your family of four to be comfortable in one room.

author: mattoleary
segments: Can't fault it...
I am lucky enough to travel to Tokyo quite a lot and I always stay at the Okura (South Wing).
Colleagues ask me why when I can stay at one of the massive chain hotels, also on the approved list.
The answer is pretty simple - you just cannot fault the Okura for price, location and for comfort.A previous reviewer commented on the decor seeming old fashioned.
It's like stepping into my nan's living room with brown and orange geometric patterned carpets and 70s furniture.
It's not true to say that it hasn't been renovated, though.
Part of the beauty of the Okura is that they *do* renovate it every few years - they just keep it the same way and I kind of like that.

Over the past few years, major chains such as the Grand Hyatt, Conrad (and most recently) the Ritz Carlton have opened up in Tokyo, but I am a big fan of the Japanese-style service at the Okura - honestly nothing is too much trouble, and the response time is ludicrously fast when you call for help - laundry, iron etc.

The big chains and their attempt to instill some americana into Japan result in a dilution of the excellent Japanese service ethic, which as visitors will know, is out of this world, but very rule-bound.

Top tip for frequent visitors is the Okura Club International which you can join for nothing and entitles bearers to free usage of the pool, showers and o-furo (bath) which you would normally have to pay for.

In addition, you get two laundry vouchers for complimentary shirt wash and press (really handy) and a drinks voucher, which is perfect for a quick glass of wine before you hit the sack.I have spent many a night in the Highlander Bar which is possibly the tackiest Scottish theme bar in the world, but apparently a favourite of John Lennon and Yoko Ono (The Okura's Presidential Suite was home for the lovely couple during their time in Tokyo, I am told).
Even if this is an urban myth, I don't care.

I really can't imagine John and Yoko sitting amongst the crap Scottish memorabilia, but I hope it's true.I have only ever eaten at the Chinese restaurant in the Okura - To Ka Lin - and it is exquisite.
Expensive though, but it is supposedly the best Chinese restaurant in Japan.
Not sure about that - take a trip to Yokohama's Chinatown - but it is very good if you're feeling lazy and can't be bothered to venture out of the hotel.
If you're heading to Tokyo, whether it's business or pleasure, I definitely recommend the Okura. 70s kitsch, crap Scottish bar - it's all good.

author: iheartvaca
segments: Nice boutique hotel in a fabulous city!
I鈥檓 working on fulfilling my New Year鈥檚 resolution to be more diligent about writing hotel reviews on tripadvisor!We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December 2006.
Overall Hotel California offers a fantastic value.
The two things that really did it for me were the beds (very comfortable and we loved the flannel sheets!)
and the free internet with printer on the mezzanine.
Our room was not large but nicely decorated and very sunny with a good sized bay window looking out onto Geary Street.
I did not notice traffic sounds during our stay, but I also sleep like the dead so it鈥檚 no surprise.
The room had wood floors so I halfway expected my socks to pick up dust and whatnot walking around, but the floor was spotless- as was the entire room.
The staff members were generally very helpful and pleasant.
Several times they assisted us with public transportation schedules and attraction information.
Note: None of them appeared to be a 'concierge' per se and noone offered to make us dinner reservations when asked about restaurants, so expect to take care of these details on your own.
We love boutique hotels with eclectic features, so this was a good fit for us.
If you prefer large corporate-style hotels this may not be the place for you.
Next time we are in San Fran we will likely stay at the Westin, but as a more economical alternative only 2 blocks down, this place is great!
Honestly, this may be one of the best values in San Fran, a place that defies the meaning of 'value'.
We were only disappointed we couldn鈥檛 stay longer in this great city.

author: rachelbsn
segments: Friendly staff, great location
My husband and I stayed at the Park Hotel and enjoyed our time in Amsterdam.
The hotel is in a great location!
The staff was so friendly and helpful, and our room was above average, considering the norm for hotels in Europe.
The prices were high, but the location can't be beat.

author: unclechuckle  <Content>perfect.. managed to get what seemed a really good deal - $111 a night for a week in early July.
segments: Knew the seminyak area well but hads never stayed at the Sofitel before.
was slightly cautious after reviews on here but was more than happy with what we ended up with - room was fine, perfectly large enough for European tastes.
Did have the same problem with aircon but it was stuck on 23C not 25, so not such a problem.
breakfast fantastic, as everyone has said before, and ate drank around the pool most days - certainly no complaints, and given the decent GBP/USD rate no complaints re prices.
Wine a touch expensive, but other stuff - beer (拢1.
20), cocktails well within our budgets.
food also of a very good standard.
I would agree that sometimes the standard isn't great all the time, but they do at least make the effort, which is half the point in my opinion.
For what we paid I have nothing to complain about, and will happily return.

author: DAVIDJORGE
segments: Wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!!
Just got back from a wonderful 4 day trip to NYC and had such a greatl experience staying at the Chelsea Lodge.
We went fully aware that the rooms were small, and yes they were, but spotless and charming.
It is called a LODGE...and that's exactly what it felt like.
Staff was very nice and welcoming.
Shared toilets are not a problem at all.
Great air conditioning...and we needed it as it was very hot.
Located on a very safe street in Chelsea...steps away from many restaurants and cafes.
For great morning coffee and pastries try La Bergamote on 9th Ave at 20th.
The Lasagna Ristorante on 8th is very good as well.
Staying at the Chelsea Lodge makes u feel as if you are living there and not just a visitor to a typical sterile hotel room.

If you are expecting a 5 star luxury hotel with all ammenities then you will probably be disappointed with the Chelsea Lodge....but for those who want an affordable,safe clean accomodation with lots of character right in the middle of everything...u cannot beat this place.
Could go on for days about how pleased we were.
Such a great find....we will DEFINITELY be back.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: An experience of a lifetime
Service was great!!!
Greater: Lizandro Rodriguez, was very friendly and curteous the whole week I was there.
He made sure I was happy.
When I arrived to the hotel I was very sick and he send medicine to my room as well as room service.
Thank's to him I was able to enjoy my stay.
I'm planing my next vacation for next year.

author: Gabster2
segments: Loved it all!
Stayed here between 13th Oct and 17th Oct.
After travelling for 16 days across the USA, ie, Anaheim,Las Vegas New York, we were ready for some rest and relaxation and that is what we got.
The room was great with partial ocean views and city views even though we'd only paid for city views.
Big enough and confortable for my husband, daughter and me.
Right across from the International Market Place and close to any shop or bus stop or anything you wanted.
Dukes was fantastic, we had breakfast there every morning and also dinner once.
The staff were excellent- very friendly even during and after the earthquake.
Can't commend the staff highly enough including the General Manager Greg, during this difficult time.
We were all fed free of charge, breakfast, lunch and dinner and everyone had smiles on their faces.
They were even baking cookies and making popcorn at 8.30 pm, when we still had no electricity.

We had friends at other hotels that were fed but had to pay for their meals even though they queued up just like us.I would highly recommend this hotel and my family are already planning our trip back in 2008.
Mahalo and Aloha!!!!!!!

author: goneallthetime
segments: Good location - average rooms - Great Exec Lounge
We stayed with our daughters at this downtown Hilton property for three night over the holiday weekend.
We had a nice view of the bay, although some buildings got in the way.
The front desk staff was very polite and helpful with me, but I did see them treat some older guests with a little disrespect.
Parking was a joke at $26.00 per nite.
On the positive side - the Executive Lounge, although a little cramped, offered free drinks and appetizers everynight from 5 - 9pm and the Exec Concierge was very helpful.
He put together a dinner at Salty's that included a complimentary limo ride to and from the Hilton - a big win for the kids.
I would stay here again on points of for business, but if it was my own money I might look around before booking it.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: A Gem of a
Hotel for Tourists For those on vacation to Mexico City, you can't get any better than this lovely hotel.
Its location is perfect, overlooking a beautiful cathedral, the national palace, the ruins of the Aztec pyramids, and one of the largest squares in the world.
More historical and cultural sites are within walking distance than we could possibly see in our 5 day stay.
We arrived in the evening and had dinner on the terrace at the hotel restaurant, looking out over the historical center and the twinkling city lights.
A breathtaking view by any standard.
As late June is in the rainy season, the air was quite clean.
The hotel's breakfast buffet is bountiful and delicious, and the prices reasonable.
Our room was small, but very clean and had a nice high ceiling and a safe.
By international standards, the price of the room was very reasonable.
We recommend visiting the excavation of the Aztec pyramids next to the national cathedral, about a five minute walk from the hotel.
Also, the food at the nearby Cafe de Tacuba is excellent.
For visiting sites in other areas of the city (we loved visiting Frido Kahlo's Blue House in Coyoacan), the hotel will arrange for taxi service.
The driver can take you from place to place, for a reasonable price.
This is much safer and far more convenient than hailing taxis from the street.

author: DeveA666
segments: As city hotels go........
Slap bang in the middle of Mong Kok, 25 mins from the airport is this impressive structure connected to a shopping mall which is at best average by HK's high shopping standards.
Check in on a Thursday evening was rapid we chose this hotel on kowloon side as we were there for business.
This hotel was The Business.
StaffImmediate upgrade to larger triple with excellent views.

Reception staff were first class, concierge service was equally as gracious with an ambundance of local knowledge from advice as to where to get a good pint to the best place for toys, complete with a beware the quality reminder.
I did require a doctor whilst there as I had forgot to pack some cruical medication that was available on prescription only.

The duty manager spoke to me in person and advised me to go to my room whilst he sorted this out within 5 minutes I was on the phone to the hotels sub contracted doctor who advised me to travel to see him as it would be quicker and cheaper.
From pressing the lift buttons for you to helping you in and out of taxi's, to there genuine pleasure in serving you.
This was a refreshing change and something staff at the supposed super resorts in Dubai (I have Madinat Jumeirah in Mind) should take note of.
Truly truly gob smacking pioneering customer service with little touches everywhere, amazing gracious service.

The room, all mod cons, plasma, dvd, stereo, wireless keyboard for the internet (chargeable), quiet and reliable air con, nice window seat built into the ledge, reasonable min bar prices, pillow menu, slippers, gown etc.
The rooms are fresh, crisp, well maintained, bathrooms are spacious enough and the 'open' bathroom is easily rectified by simply drawing the blinds.
Restaurants and bars Very good from bar snacks, to the chinese (Ming Court I think?)
restaurant the food quality is good.

You do have an awful amount of choice within the attached shopping centre from mcdonalds, deli france, pizzas so if you are budgeting and saving cash for the shops its pitched well for you.LocationDon't be put off by Mong Kok. Its not rough by Uk standards its quite charming and has a chinese bustle to it.
You are safe and there are more than enough shops in the immediate locality for you to have a browse around.
There is a shortage of good local bars however but don't worry.
Its only 60-80 HKD to the Wan Chai bars and central.
Again same price to the Mall at Harbour city which is a good one in my opinion.
You can also use the MTR which is 4 mins from the hotel.
Clean, fast and efficient a pleasure to use, journey time into central/ causeway bay 10 mins max.
You can also use the star ferry(pennies) on the Kowloon side which will drop you island side adjacent to harbour city mall which is a good spot to take the classic harbour panoramic photo.
I have no qualms about staying Kowloon side the hotels tend to be cheaper.
OverallI've been a very lazy trip advisor for years.
I should have posted reviews about the Atlantis Bahamas, Loewes Miami beach, Mina A Salam Dubai, Westin Times Square New York, numerous eastern shangri la's.

This hotel beats the pants off them and I will be using them again in April/mayThis Hotel its not a beach resort if it was the sand would be raked hourly men would clean your sunglasses every 15 minutes, fruit cocktails on sticks, cucumbers for the eyes etc.
The hotel and its staff are excellent go and enjoy a fantastic city hotel.
Flights Virgin (Direct booking) Truly Rubbish service both ways and I like Virgin.
Hotel Booked via expedia excellent rate, though Asiarooms.
com had excellent rates for April 2008 when I last checked.

author: cjlee32
segments: Hotel Vintage Park
I just got back from staying at Hotel Vintage Park and their staff is excellent.
We were celebrating our 1st yr anniversary and the hotel upgraded our room to a King Premiere and gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne.
The hotel is located in a pretty good location, in the shopping district and about a 1/2 mile walk to Pike's Market.
The hotel itself is small and older but the staff makes up for it.

author: Escapefromthedesert
segments: Heart of HollywoodO
It is in a great location for the Hollywood area, it is right next to a subway stop, but to get around in Los Angeles you will need a car.
The room was comfortable with a great view of Los Angeles.
We were placed next to the service elevator and the walls were on the thin side.
So, be sure to tell them in advance if noise bothers you.
The bed was comfortable.
The food was expensive in the hotel.
Though, there are a significant number of places to eat within walking distance.
The lobby is somewhat chic and the neighborhood is a very typical Hollywood neighbor hood.
It is safe to walk except take care at night.I would recommend the hotel for first time visitors.

author: uklad79
segments: Good location shame
Hollywood is such a dump The hotel is fine and is a short walk to the Hollywood Highland or the Hollywood Bowl.
The lobby is very small and looks newly refitted.
The rooms are clean and modern we were on the top floor in a room overlooking the pool so we had a good view of the hills and had no noise problems.
The resturant serves a good buffet breakfast for around $12 which is well worth it.
There is a Subway Starbucks store over the road which is very handy.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: Just Fantastic I stayed there for 3 nights on my
Easter holidays and all I can say is that the place was great.
The room was small but not tiny.
The bed was very comfortable and everything was kept really clean.
The bathroom was small but perfect with a powerful shower.
All the tiles had been changed recently and the walls painted (it still smelt of paint).
My room was number 9 and was really quiet.

Breakfast was very good, you could choose between coffee or tea, orange juice or cereal, fried egg, grilled bacon and baked beens, two boiled eggs or ham and tomato, and also they gave you toast with butter, jam and marmalade.
The staff was kind and helpful, always smily.
The location was just perfect, very close to Victoria Station in a very nice and quiet neighbourhood.
Bus n24 stops opposite the hotel and goes to Westminster, the Parliament, Trafalgar Square, Leicester Square, Tottenham Court (British Museum), Camden Town........Absolutely convenient.
There were underground stations five minutes away (Victoria and Pimlico) but the bus was better and not so crowded.
There were also plenty of restaurants and pubs nearby.
I can recommend a Turkish restaurant in Wilton Road called Mezze (but book in advance if you want to have dinner there as it's quite busy).
There was a Sainsbury's supermarket close to the hotel and also a Tesco.I will definitely stay there again!!!!

author: dylanm
segments: What?!
Just Ok
My husband and I stayed here for a quick weekend trip and besides the location were not all that impressed.
The cava at reception is a nice touch though we had to ask for a glass (?)
We were in Gravina II which I think might be a newer section on the 5th floor.
Because we were traveling with a small child we needed to use the elevator which barely held myself and a child, but you still had to go up stairs to get to the elevator to Gravina II.
THE MOVING FURNITURE SOUND UNCOVERED, it is the ceiling mounted radio speaker!!
For some reason the radio can be controlled on the headboard of the bed and the speaker is mounted in the ceiling.
Cool I guess, but the problem is even on volume as low as it will go it comes on supper supper loud with this Errerrrt sound, and you quickly turn it back off.
Once we did it we started noticing others doing the same thing which does sound like furniture moving.
The room initially looked good until closer inspection showed molding coming unglued and loose caulking in the shower.
Not that big of a deal but maybe spend the $$ fixing these instead of a celing mounted radio that is useless!
We were lucky enough not to get the two twin beds pushed together although this was the hardest bed I have slept on.
(another place that $$ could have gone)The breakfast is crap I tell you!
and was more worth the 10Euros with the discount on the first day.
Take a left when you exit the hotel and there is a wonderful bakery down the next street open early for freash breakfast.
WAYYY better than my runny eggs and 4EUro Coke at the hotel.
On the other hand the staff was very friendly and honest.
Im not saying this isnt a good hotel for the price and location, but I would look around before I would stay here again.

author: davcat
segments: Great Location and really clean
Myslef and 10 friends stayed here for 5 nights over the first weekend in December.
The Courtyard is very clean and is in a great location only 10 mins from Macys/Newbury Street.
I would definitely stay there again.

However, just a couple of small things - one of our triple rooms was really small, only fit as a double and there was no mirror in the bedroom at all, just the bathroom mirror so it was a bit of hassle when 3 women were getting ready to go out.
So if you are checking in and they allocate room 1238, make sure you have your own mirror.
Overall a great stay and the shopping was brill, much better than NY.

author: car2sh
segments: stay away Just came back from eight nighjts at this hotel.
Stay elsewhere if at all possible.
Situated in a section of Madrid east of the Retiro park, you could be anywhere where high rise buildings predominate.
No atmosphere.
Inconvenient to everything.
Everything in hotel done on the cheap.
Clean.
Staff disorganized and surly.
Even refused to call for taxis.
Breakfast lackluster.
See my review of Senator Gran Via where I stayed the preceding week.

author: JennyB01
segments: Well placed hotel
Booked this hotel because of reviews in Trip Advisor.
It is very well placed for central Paris - 10 minutes walk to Eiffel Tower, Pont d'Alma.
Well served by buses and a metro station less than 5 minutes walk away.
Plenty of eating places with varied prices all around.
Small supermarket and patisserie literally a minute from hotelOn a quiet, narrow street, the hotel is small but quiet.
We had a room with double and single bed and it was a reasonable size.
Shower area was small though and door didn't fit so the floor got wet!

I liked that wine and soft drinks were available with honesty payments and a fridge to store your own purchases but felt it was a lack that there was no coffee or tea-making facilities either in room or in area where could have lunch.
It was good to have that area, but there wasn't anywhere really comfortable to sit either in eating area or your room.
The TV was really high up and awkward to see.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: Beautiful resort Just got back last night from a one week stay at the Sirenis Cocotal.
I went with my 15 year old daughter and a friend of mine.
We were very impressed with the facilities and the people.
The food was plentiful and very tasty.
None of us were sick and as far as I know no one else at the resortl was ill.
The mosquitos were not a problem either.
There is something for everyone there.
We rented a couple of four wheeled dirt bikes and rode up the hillside and through a village.
It was wonderful.
Very fun and nice to see the countryside.
My daughter fell in love with the staff at the resort.
The animation (entertainment) crew were terrific.
Very energetic and funny.
We will definetely go back.

author: Canadaraveller
segments: Top Notch My wife and
I just spent 4 nights at the Four Seasons Boston.
It is a wonderful hotel in a perfect location to explore Boston.
The rooms are spacious and the bed and duvet were very comfortable.
The service was second to none.....if you can't be pleased here than you can't be pleased anywhere.
Bravo.

author: N7tripper
segments: As expected Typical of this sort of hotel with rooms fitted and finished to a high standard, polite and attentive staff, good food, smart and spacious communal areas although these are beginning to look slightly dated now.
Location was not ideal although in any big city no location is ideal for everywhere anyway.
Basically everything we would have expected from a hotel under this brand.

author: cher57
segments: Good hotel We booked our hotel and flight to
Barcelona over the net.
The flight went to Girona, so we got the bus to the station and you could see the hotel from the entrance, only 2 mins walk.
Check in was fine.
The hotel looked very new.
Our room was on the 4th floor, facing the street, we could open the window and look out.
Very nice furnishings, free mini bar, the beer was awful but we enjoyed the water, juice and coke.
The bathroom was very nice, the bath was really big to lie in.
We walked to the Sagrada , the Ramblas and beach from the hotel and we also used the metro.
The 2 ladies on reception were very helpful and kind to us.
The internet was free but I do think people should only be allowed say 30 mins and its written in a book, thats a fair way I think.
We tried the bakery across the road, had cold pizza and cake, very nice.
We would definetely stay at this hotel again.

author: clairey20
segments: Absolutely fantastic!!
Stayed here for a hen trip with 3 of my girlfriends for 3 nights.
We only booked 1 room which was fine as the beds were huge as was the room/suite.
Room contained a small kitchenette which was perfect for storing bottles of wine! Was enough space for 4 girls all with big cases and lots of shopping.
Staff are friendly and very helpful.
Hotel location is excellent - walking distance from Bloomingdales, Central Park and subway stations.

The only complaint is that we arrived at noon but were not able to check in until 3 - my fault though as should have checked before we came.I would certainly stay here again - it is peaceful and very clean, the prices see to have gone up by alot since we stayed though!

author: wawawa
segments: Good central hotel.
I have stayed in this hotel twice.
It is perhaps a bit old fashioned but very comfortable.
The rooms were very well furnished but the bathroom in one of them was poor for a 4star hotel.
The location is superb and having a tram stop 20metres away is a real bonus.

author: cjp2
segments: Pretty Nice!
I stayed here seven nights while attending a conference at the convention center.
The room was a bit smaller than the typical hotel room, but it was clean and looked well kept.
The hallways smelled a little funky, but tolerable.
The first floor (lobby, restaurant, shops) were all nicely decorated and clean.
The staff was very welcoming and helpful.
My view (20th floor) looked west to north and was pretty nice.
Knowing the area, I knew I wasn't going to have too much of an ocean view.
Location in downtown Waikiki can't be beat.
You're right across the street from Duke's bar and the Mai Tai bar at the Royal Hawaiian!
Easy walk to the beach and the aquarium (highly recommend!).
The hike to the convention center is not horrible, but longer than I anticipated, especially in long pants at 2:00 in the afternoon.
A nice place and I would probably stay there again.

author: AMSbug
segments: They lost my reservation
I was attracted to Hotel Fita by its location and offer of free internet and long-distance telephone.
I contacted them via their web site and reserved about six weeks in advance.
When I arrived in Amsterdam, I went to the hotel and was told that they had no reservation for me, were not expecting me, and that they were full for the night.
In the end, they helped me find another room for one night nearby (at perhaps the worst hotel I've stayed at in twenty years) and then gave me a room upgrade for the remaining night.
Aside from my dealings with the owner (who was less than hospitable and crossed out my entry in their guest book), the staff were great and the hotel was clean and modern.

author: quiltlover
segments: Yes, we liked it,too.
After many years it was wonderful to come back to Boston.
We enjoyed this hotel and it麓s location very much.
As lots of others have said already, all stuff is great and helpful.
The concierge Charles went out of his way to help us with tickets.
The lobby was a little small and got crowded one monrning whena larger group of people arrived.
Our room was spacious and the bed very comfy.

There was only one problem which was a little letdown:there was a connecting door to the room next to us and at around4 o麓clock in the morning people were talking so loud, that we could not sleep any longer.
It happend again once more at about the same time.
Real bad.But other than that we liked it here.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: Great surprise...
San Gallo was a pleasant surprise in Florence.
We were given room 205 with a huge balcony over the main entrance of the hotel, huge bedroom and living room for the same price we paid for a small room in Rome.
This hotel was very clean, large bathroom and the closet space was great too.
Two welcome drinks at their bar.
Breakfast rooms were inside or outside: cereal; scrambled eggs, bacon, cheese, ham, breads, pastries, yogurt, fruit, jams, bottled water and good coffee.
Hotel faces Piazza della Liberta.
Bus #1 from the train station is most direct but #25 and #33 will get you there also.
This hotel is on the other side of the Piazza from the bus stop (caddy corner to the large statue at the archway of the Piazza).
I would stay here again.
There is a wine bar called Nabucca on Via XXVII April, which had a nice spread of appetizers, complimentary with drinks.
They had a great wine selection from all over Italy.
Not a far walk to the Duomo, farther walk to Ufizzi but manageable if you like to walk.
All roads lead to the Duomo, it is hard to escape its gravity.
Have fun and stay at the San Gallo Palace.

author: dinibell
segments: Okay As others have mentioned this is clearly a motel (on the order of

Days inn or Super 8) and nothing more:Pros: clean, comfortable beds, off Polk with a great bagel shop and other nice shops and restaurants, easy 5 block walk to bus that takes you to Union Square in about 10 minutes, helpful hosts, priceCons: Air freshener in rooms -ewH!

had to bust open windows after room was cleaned, too far and ugly to walk to Chinatown or North Beach (they suggest that you walk through this filthy long tunnel to get there and if you don't its longer (and just as un-scenic), super noisy!!
walls are made of paper!,

stomping people above us, loud car and nightclub noise outside, etc., etc.,continental breakfast served from 7:30-9am (never saw it - we're on vacation - who's getting up and out that early on the weekend??)
I would recommend the place to anyone on a budget as you get a clean room for the money but I don't think I'd stay here again.

author: oakhesd
segments: really special This was our first time staying in this hotel one word covers it all
WOW .
The staff were very very helpful, the rooms were wonderful Will we return??
You bet we will soon as possible

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: Ladder with Carpet
Lets get things straight, This place is great if you don鈥檛 mind some compromise.I stayed on the Top Floor (Third Floor) Room 12, which I must say had its advantage.
.On the good side :No People traipsing past your door when you eventually get back (My Room).

It鈥檚 a RoomIt鈥檚 DryIt鈥檚 SecureThe people are friendly enoughIt鈥檚 CheepThe Sheets are cleanClean ToiletsOn the Bad Side :Three Single beds and a Matress in the roomIn need of decoration Beds look like they come from a prisonStairs are so steep near the top they are more like a carpeted ladder on steroids.
You can have breakfast and Drinks if you do it yourself and buy the ingredients.
The Shower just has a small shelf to put all your stuff on.Personally I will stay elsewhere next time I am over in the dam.

author: Eiger20
segments: Great location and service
My wife and I stayed at Casa Alta Vista for 2 nights in December.
Overall, the room was worth the price.
The room we had was small but had enough room for two people (assuming you aren't spending much time in the room).
The bathroom was sufficient and for the most part clean.
We actually had a spectacular view of the mountains from a small window in our shower (Rm #12).
The service was excellent and we found that the staff went out of their way to accomodate us (make dinner reservations, give directions, taxi pick-up's, etc.).

The rooftop deck has an amazing view and is great for lounging at night and for eating a quick breakfast (for cheap and easy breakfast go to La Dulce _____ panederia - walk one block towards ocean and make first left and then first right).
We also had our own patio area where where we could hang wet clothes, snokel gear, etc. (seperate patio but not secluded from view of other rooms).
Esperanza main strip is only 5 min walk from hotel.

A few minor down sides were tin roof (we had 3rd floor room and heavy rains were LOUD), roosters making noise quite often (yes, even in middle of night), and rental charges for everything (bikes, towels, chairs, etc.)
We rented bikes for $15/day from hotel but they were in pretty poor condition.
We were able to bike all the way to Blue Beach but it took an hour and was difficult since bikes were stuck in low gear.
Be careful snorkeling at Red Beach.
We swam out to island about 100 yds off shore only to realize that current on way in was very strong.
I would not suggest doing this without fins unless you are VERY strong swimmer and even take caution with fins if you are a strong swimmer.
Currents can be dangerous and ther are no warnings.
Snorkeling really wasn't worth the effort.
Note that if you plan to rent a car, many rental places have minimum 3 day rentals during high season.
The small, basic rooms are made up for by the great location and roof top views.
The convenience store downstairs is nice to grab a snack or a 6-pack of beer.
I'm guessing this is one of best accomadations near Esperanza for this price range.
Our favorite beach was Blue Beach and Playa Luna.
If you get there in teh morning you can easily have 300 yds of sand to yourself.
We loved the beaches on Vieques and the lack of crowds made it all the more wonderful.

author: centrecourt
segments: Dare I say "Perfect"?
Content>I've been to GV on four seperate occasions.
Each time I vist, they increasingly treat me like a king -- meeting me at my taxi/car whereupon four or five people greet me by name, escorting me to my (always upgraded room) via private elevator.
It's heaven.
And, if you are not wealthy, you should visit the cafe anyway.
Have an expensive coffee and pastry and soak in the sublime atmosphere.
For all the wealth that flows here, you will NOT feel out of place or of a lesser class.
Every guest is treated with near-honor.
Sure, there are hiccups from time to time, but just speak up -- they will apologize and go beyond in making things right.
Among the finest hotels in Paris -- and the world.

author: pyramid111
segments: Lots to recommend this hotel The
Rex has a lot of positives.
It is well located, near Union Square with lots of shops and restaurants nearby.
The staff are friendly and the rooms, while small, are clean and well furnished.

There is free wireless Internet access in the rooms and another nice touch is the free glass of wine served between 5 and 6 - this ensures the guests gravitate to the lounge and creates a warm, friendly atmosphere.
We had breakfast in the restuarant and it was good although there are plenty of other good restaurants and diners nearby.
The only fault we would find is in the lack of tea and coffee making facilities in the rooms.
All in all, a good value mid range hotel.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: Expected better Stayed with my wife and two teenage children for four nights.
The hotel is well located and the renovated rooms were adequate in terms of size and amenities but I would not rate them 4 star.
Some areas of the hotel need upgrading.
We found the service variable, ranging from very helpful to down right rude and argumentative when we checked in having used a booking service instead of the hotel's direct system.

We found the dining options expensive even for a chain and considering the plethora of great places to eat within walking distance, I would recommend dining out.If you can secure a special rate and spend most of your time out and about, then the location will compensate for the hotel's downsides.
Otherwise I would look elsewhere.

author: dminner1
segments: Great place and great people...
I really liked this place and will go back.
You can find specials and packages on their website..
The drinks and the view at the bar on the roof are great, but the sushi was average.
The staff is awesome.

author: Zreis  <Content>Liars.....Cheaters.....and Rude to boot.
segments: First and formost this hotel is a nice property, how ever the rooms are not at all as they tell on the website.
I booked a one bedroom (bedroom) being a key word there) Suite....It was not a suite by any defiinition.
It was a normal sized regular room with a pull down bed with a small divider in the middle of the beds.
THATS NOT A SUITE....THATS A LOAD OF CRAP.
I reserved a top floor suite with ocean veiw.....they put me on the first floor over looking a ton of screaming kids.
The room was supposed to have two TV's.
It had one.
When I called to ask about it, I was told that the was not the case and that the internet website does not have a second tv listed for the one bedroom suite....and low and behold...it does.
As I was on my first floor balcony smoking a ciggarette to calm my nerves from dealing with this, somone from a top floor decided to spit and hit me in the back on my head and my hand.
Imagine the anger.

You book a top floor, you get first floor, you booked a suite, and got a room...you go out to your balcony to relax...and someone from a top floor....(which you reserved) has just spit on the back of your head.
The hotels idea of compensasion was breakfast for two.
NOT A NEW ROOM, NOT A SUITE, NOT A TOP FLOOR...but breakfast.
Yay!
After 2 hours of dealing with the floor manager (Matthew Sims) ..(If you ever have to deal with this man, go above him.
He will do nothing but smile in your face and tell you have a nice day after he has ruined it.)
I decdied to find another hotel, at a higher rate, and after driving 4 hours on no sleep after working a 12 hour shift.
Seems like this would be the end of the nightmare right?
WRONG!!!
Two days after the ordeal with the Newport Beachside Resort I was on my way home, and decided to pull money out of my account for the turnpike home.
The NewPort Beachside Resort had put a charge hold on my debit card.
I had no money to get home!!!!!!!!!!!
I called, and spoke with Matthew Sims once again just to be laughed at and told to have a nice day.
I decided that Mr. Sims would change his tune when he was confronted with this issue in person, and in front of other guests....I was wrong.
I watched Mr Sims.
(Newport Beachside Resort Manager) give a coupe the same line of crap that he gave to my girlfriend and I.
I was disgusted and appauled by his actions.
I was told by Mr. Sims that I should mind my own business to keep things civil I was told that Security would be called, and threatened with police.
The Police were called to the resort, and just so happens the Manager above Mr. Matthew Sims was standing at the front desk.
The other manager (Mr. Valdez) was very helpfull and helped me on my way.
However.....he charged my debit card a total of $484.
00 instead of giving me $140.
00 from the $343.
00 that they had already held from my bank account.
So on the way home I was once more reminded of my vacation stay at the Newport Beachside Resort when I had to be embarassed and use my high intrest credit card to pay for dinner.
This hotel ruined not only my weekend, but my vacation and the relaxation I hoped to get.
Imagine working a high stress, high liability job....only to go on vacation and deal with same type of people.I DO NOT RECOMEND ANYONE TO STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!
Feel free to contact me via E-mailZacharias J ReisPba_fla@yahoo.
com

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: Get it booked!
Have just returned from a weekend in Barcelona with 12 girlfriends who all had a fantastic time at the H10 Marina.
We found the staff (especially the reception and bar staff) extremely friendly.

Our weekend got off to a bad start when one girl had her purse pinched on the metro (be very careful) but the reception staff were very helpful and told us exactly what we needed to do and where the police station was.
They also gave her some vouchers for a couple of free drinks!

I read some negative reviews on here before our visit regarding the rooms - all our rooms were clean, spacious (they accommodated an extra bed in double rooms to make things cheaper), the air conditioning worked and the windows opened.
The roof top pool, ok is on the small side but the beach is only 5 minutes walk away if you need more water!
I really could not fault this hotel - the lobby and bar area is spacious and the breakfast had a wide range to suit all tastes.
I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.
If I was to give one tip then take a taxi from the airport - we got the train and then the metro but had to make few changes along the way.
Our minibus which the hotel booked for us returning to the airport only cost 55 euro's between 6 of us.

author: A TripAdvisor Member
segments: Great place to stay
We have now stayed at the Nob Hill Motor Inn three times and have been there several nights each time we were in San Franscisco.
We have never been disappointed.
The people who run this inn are very helpful, friendly, and resourceful.
Our room has always been very clean, quiet, and comfortable.
It is located conveniently close to public transportation and we have always been given good directions at the front desk.
We definitely will go back the next time we visit the area.

author: Desirees
segments: unbeatable Location I had booked 3 rooms via
Priceline, and had then contacted the hotel directly asking if I could have the rooms close together.
Rene Wildeman replied immediately and the reservations department got back to me letting me know they would try to put us together, and then offered us an upgrade for $31 per night per room.
We accepted it, and was glad we did since I saw a regular room later on and it was tiny.
I am pretty sure our luggage would not fit in there.
We took the train from Schipol to Central Station and then walked the straight road to the hotel.
It was about 7 mins away.
Check in was prompt, the desk people were very friendly and the rooms were ok.
They were dark since they were in the back with no view at all but the size of the rooms were amazing.
I did not like the toiletries that came with the hotel however.
The shampoo felt like watered down laundry detergent.
I would recommend taking your own supply.
Also, a warning, be careful of what you sign up for as wireless internet.
We were told to open the internet page and follow instructions to sign up for internet.
Well, we turned on my laptop and Tmobile came up.
So we signed up for it, and lost signal right after that.
